requirement.topic: Allows Java clients to poll synchronously for messages with the get() method, and access the up to date message high performing from a local cache.
requirement.description:
The Java I_XmlBlasterAccess class (the Java client side interface) has a built in cache. If you activate this cache with the initCache() method, the xmlBlasterAccess.get() method accesses a message on the first call synchronously and returns it to you.
Behind the scenes, a subscribe() is done as well, and incoming updates of this messages are put into the cache.
Following get() invocations for the same message, are retrieved from the local cache.
Note that this is a pure client behavior, and for the moment the only reference implementation is in Java.
